content: Does anybody use the interface between Lean and Wolfram Mathematica in their work? I'd like to see some cool projects that combine these two technologies.

I think that this interface works with neither the latest lean nor the latest mathematica (in fact IIRC a new release of Mathematica broke the interface shortly after it was up and running) and nobody is maintaining it.
I think at that point it's mostly a proof of concept. When it gets users, this might change.
Martin Dvořák has marked this topic as resolved.

It works fine. The examples repo is based on mathlib from September, and there are probably slight updates to make it work with modern mathlib, but there shouldn't be anything major broken. I haven't tested it with Mathematica 13 but it should be fine on 12.3
I'll update the examples repo when I'm back at a computer with Mathematica installed, and test on 13. Since there aren't really any customers right now we've been lazy about keeping things up to date
Oh I'm really sorry for circulating misinformation Rob! I thought you told me a long time ago that Mathematica had upgraded and the bridge was broken.
No worries, that was the case a long time ago, but we updated it when our journal paper was accepted
